api/Attributo.Editor.LicenseDataEditor.h.title: Class LicenseDataEditor | Attributo: Pro License Manager Documentation
api/Attributo.Editor.LicenseDataEditor.h.summary: Class LicenseDataEditor Provides a custom inspector interface for the LicenseData ScriptableObject. Inheritance object Object ScriptableObject Editor LicenseDataEditor Namespace: Attributo.Editor Assembly: Attributo.Editor.dll Syntax [CustomEditor(typeof(LicenseData))] public class LicenseDataEditor : Editor Remarks This editor extension allows developers to automatically synchronize their license assets with the official SPDX (Software Package Data Exchange) database. It handles remote web requests, JSON parsing, and asset serialization. Methods | Edit this page View Source OnInspectorGUI() Renders the custom inspector GUI. Declaration public override void OnInspectorGUI() Overrides UnityEditor.Editor.OnInspectorGUI() Remarks In addition to the default inspector, this adds buttons for: Fetching license text from the SPDX API. Converting standard identifiers to 'LicenseRef-' custom identifiers.

api/Attributo.Editor.LicenseHubWindow.ht.title: Class LicenseHubWindow | Attributo: Pro License Manager Documentation
api/Attributo.Editor.LicenseHubWindow.ht.summary: Class LicenseHubWindow The central administrative interface for the License Manager system. Inheritance object Object ScriptableObject EditorWindow LicenseHubWindow Namespace: Attributo.Editor Assembly: Attributo.Editor.dll Syntax public class LicenseHubWindow : EditorWindow Remarks This window provides a comprehensive overview of all licenses applied within the project. It facilitates two primary workflows: Audit: Visualizing and verifying license distribution across project folders. Export: Generating legally compliant attribution documents (TXT/MD) for production builds. Methods | Edit this page View Source ShowWindow() Declaration [MenuItem("Window/License Manager/License Hub")] public static void ShowWindow()

api/Attributo.Editor.LicenseImportDetect.title: Class LicenseImportDetector | Attributo: Pro License Manager Documentation
api/Attributo.Editor.LicenseImportDetect.summary: Class LicenseImportDetector An automated background processor that monitors the Unity Asset Database for new imports. Inheritance object AssetPostprocessor LicenseImportDetector Namespace: Attributo.Editor Assembly: Attributo.Editor.dll Syntax public class LicenseImportDetector : AssetPostprocessor Remarks This class inherits from UnityEditor.AssetPostprocessor to intercept asset import events. Its primary responsibility is to detect unlicensed third-party content as it enters the project and prompt the user to assign the appropriate legal documentation via the LicenseSelectionWindow.

Effective CoverageA read-only visualization of the full license chain, including inherited licenses from parent directories. api/Attributo.Editor.LicenseLinkEditorUt.title: Class LicenseLinkEditorUtility | Attributo: Pro License Manager Documentation
api/Attributo.Editor.LicenseLinkEditorUt.summary: Class LicenseLinkEditorUtility Editor-only utility for resolving effective license hierarchy for LicenseLink. Uses the Asset Database to crawl the project folder hierarchy; safe for Editor only. Inheritance object LicenseLinkEditorUtility Namespace: Attributo.Editor Assembly: Attributo.Editor.dll Syntax public static class LicenseLinkEditorUtility Methods | Edit this page View Source GetEffectiveLicenses(LicenseLink) Resolves the full chain of licenses affecting the folder containing the given link by crawling up the project hierarchy. Declaration public static List<LicenseData> GetEffectiveLicenses(LicenseLink link) Parameters Type Name Description LicenseLink link The LicenseLink asset (must be loaded in the Asset Database). Returns Type Description List<LicenseData> A list of all LicenseData applying to this scope (including inherited from parent folders).

api/Attributo.Editor.LicenseSelectionWin.summary: Class LicenseSelectionWindow An interactive wizard used to assign licenses to project assets during or after import. Inheritance object Object ScriptableObject EditorWindow LicenseSelectionWindow Namespace: Attributo.Editor Assembly: Attributo.Editor.dll Syntax public class LicenseSelectionWindow : EditorWindow Remarks This window serves as the primary user interface for the LicenseImportDetector. It allows developers to: Search and select from a project-wide database of LicenseData. Quickly generate new license templates based on common SPDX standards. Exempt specific folders from future scans using the 'Mute' feature. api/Attributo.LicenseData.html.summary: Class LicenseData A ScriptableObject representing a single software or asset license. Inheritance object Object ScriptableObject LicenseData Namespace: Attributo Assembly: Attributo.dll Syntax [CreateAssetMenu(fileName = "CustomLicense", menuName = "Attributo/License")] public class LicenseData : ScriptableObject Remarks This data container stores the core legal information required for project compliance. It is designed to work with the SPDX (Software Package Data Exchange) standard while allowing for custom author and attribution notes. Fields | Edit this page View Source Author The original creator, copyright holder, or organization. Declaration public string? Author Field Value Type Description string | Edit this page View Source License The full, raw legal text of the license. Declaration [TextArea] public string? License Field Value Type Description string | Edit this page View Source LicenseName The display name for the license (e.g., "MIT License" or "Unity Asset Store EULA"). api/Attributo.LicenseLink.html.title: Class LicenseLink | Attributo: Pro License Manager Documentation
api/Attributo.LicenseLink.html.summary: Class LicenseLink A marker asset used to link specific folders to one or more LicenseData entries. Inheritance object Object ScriptableObject LicenseLink Namespace: Attributo Assembly: Attributo.dll Syntax public class LicenseLink : ScriptableObject Remarks LicenseLink enables a hierarchical licensing model. By placing this asset in a folder, that folder and all its subfolders inherit the assigned licenses unless overridden or supplemented by another LicenseLink deeper in the hierarchy. Effective license resolution (hierarchy crawl) is performed in the Editor via LicenseLinkEditorUtility.GetEffectiveLicenses. Fields | Edit this page View Source LinkedLicenses The specific licenses directly assigned to this folder. Declaration public LicenseData[] LinkedLicenses Field Value Type Description LicenseData[] Methods | Edit this page View Source GetCombinedNotes() Concatenates all attribution notes from the licenses directly linked to this folder. Declaration public string GetCombinedNotes() Returns Type Description string A formatted string of all relevant notes or a placeholder if empty.

index.html.title: Attributo: Pro License Manager | Attributo: Pro License Manager Documentation
index.html.summary: Attributo: Pro License Manager Attributo is an Editor-only Unity tool that automates asset attribution and third-party license compliance. By linking folders to license data and tracking imports, it helps keep your project audit-ready and simplifies generating attribution documents (e.g. ThirdPartyNotices.txt or CREDITS.md). Features Import-time prompts – When you add assets under an unlicensed folder, a wizard appears so you can assign or create licenses. Hierarchical licensing – Place a License Link in a folder; that folder and its children inherit that license until overridden by another link deeper in the tree. SPDX integration – Fetch official license text from SPDX by entering an identifier (e.g. MIT, Apache-2.0) in the License Data inspector. License Hub – Central window to audit all links and export a single attribution file with deduplicated license text and notes. Mute folders – Optionally mark a folder as “no license needed” so the import detector does not prompt again for that path. Quick links User manual – Setup, workflows, and troubleshooting (same content as the package README). Scripting API – API reference for the Attributo and Attributo.Editor assemblies. Technical note Attributo is Editor-only. The Runtime assembly (Attributo) contains only data types (LicenseData, LicenseLink). All hierarchy resolution and Asset Database usage live in the Editor assembly (Attributo.Editor), so the package has no impact on player builds or build size. Legal disclaimer Attributo is an organizational aid and does not constitute legal advice. You are responsible for verifying that all assets are correctly attributed and that license terms are followed. Always review exported attribution files before shipping.

manual/README.html.title: Attributo: Pro License Manager – User Manual | Attributo: Pro License Manager Documentation
manual/README.html.summary: Attributo: Pro License Manager – User Manual Thank you for choosing Attributo. This tool is designed to automate the tedious process of asset attribution and legal compliance within Unity. By documenting your licenses at the moment of import, you ensure your project is always "audit-ready." 1. Quick Start First-Time Setup Import the Package: Once imported, Attributo is active. You don't need to toggle any settings. The Licenses Folder: It is recommended to keep all your LicenseData assets in a central folder (e.g., Assets/Licenses). The Import Workflow When you drag a new asset (model, texture, audio, etc.) into your Assets folder: Automatic Detection: Attributo checks if the folder (or its parents) already has a license. The Wizard: If no license is found, a window will appear. Select: Choose an existing license from your library. Create: Quickly generate a new license template. Mute: If the asset is your own work, click "Skip (Mute folder)" to create an empty link and stop future prompts for that directory. 2. Managing Licenses (LicenseData) LicenseData assets are the heart of the system. They store the legal "identity" of an asset. Using the SPDX Fetcher Create a new LicenseData asset (Create > Attributo > License). Enter the SPDX Identifier (e.g., MIT, Apache-2.0, CC-BY-4.0). Click "Fetch Official SPDX Text" in the Inspector. Attributo will download the official legal text and populate the license field. Unique Attributions If you have two different assets that both use the MIT license but require different author credits: Create two separate LicenseData assets. Name one MIT_Envato_Skybox and the other MIT_GitHub_InventorySystem. Use the Notes field to store specific "Copyright (c) Year Author" lines required by the license. 3. The License Hub Access the central dashboard via Window > License Manager > License Hub. Audit Tab View every LicenseLink currently active in your project. Identify "unlicensed" gaps in your project hierarchy. Use the Ping and View buttons to locate specific assets or licenses. Export Tab Export ThirdPartyNotices.txt / CREDITS.md: Compile every unique license and note into a single file. Auto-Deduplication: If multiple folders use the same license asset, Attributo lists the legal text only once in the export. 4. Troubleshooting & FAQ Why didn't the window pop up? Attributo ignores native Unity files (e.g. .mat, .anim, .asset) and anything under Packages/ to reduce noise. Scripts (.cs) and asmdefs are also ignored. Can I license a single file? Attributo is folder-based. Assigning a license to a folder covers everything inside it. Does this work in builds? No. Attributo is Editor-only. It has no impact on game performance or build size. 5. Legal Disclaimer IMPORTANT: Attributo is an organizational aid and does not constitute legal advice. You are solely responsible for ensuring that all assets are correctly attributed and that license terms are followed. Always manually review your exported attribution file before shipping your project.
